title: CADASIL: Rare Genetic Disorder Affecting Brain Blood Vessels
short_description: Overview of CADASIL, a rare genetic disorder that affects small blood vessels in the brain with variable symptoms and progression.
long_description: This document provides an introduction to CADASIL (Cerebral Autosomal Dominant Arteriopathy with Subcortical Infarcts and Leukoencephalopathy), a rare genetic disorder first identified in 1993 that affects the small blood vessels in the brain. The document explains that CADASIL affects males and females equally across all races worldwide, with an estimated prevalence of approximately 2-5 per 100,000 people. It emphasizes the significant variability in age of onset, severity, symptoms, and disease progression, even among family members, and notes that the disorder is often undiagnosed or misdiagnosed, making accurate prevalence estimates challenging.
